body_html:
In the https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md, it was mentioned that running the following command will satisfy the need if the modified files are from aten or torch/csrc.

  -  python setup.py rebuild_libtorch

Isn't this correct? Isn't there any way to quickly compile for the changes from C++ or CUDA files? In our case, "python setup.py rebuild_libtorch" command did not work, and compiling from scratch takes too much time.

Thanks in advance!
body_text:
In the https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md, it was mentioned that running the following command will satisfy the need if the modified files are from aten or torch/csrc.
  -  python setup.py rebuild_libtorch

Isn't this correct? Isn't there any way to quickly compile for the changes from C++ or CUDA files? In our case, "python setup.py rebuild_libtorch" command did not work, and compiling from scratch takes too much time.
Thanks in advance!
body:
In the https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md, it was mentioned that running the following command will satisfy the need if the modified files are from aten or torch/csrc. 
            
      -  python setup.py rebuild_libtorch

Isn't this correct? Isn't there any way to quickly compile for the changes from C++ or CUDA files? In our case, "python setup.py rebuild_libtorch" command did not work, and compiling from scratch takes too much time.

Thanks in advance!
